org.forgerock.json.ref

Class JsonReferenceTransformer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.json.ref.JsonReferenceTransformer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JacksonReferenceTransformer

    public class JsonReferenceTransformer
extends Object
    Simple JSON reference transformer that can resolve fragment URI references. Classes can extend this class to resolve other types of URIs.

    Note: The current implementation of this class has no checks for cyclic references. This can lead to scenarios of infinite recursion and throwing of a StackOverflowError. Plans for mitigating this are in place and will be implemented within this class.

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • JsonReferenceTransformer

        public JsonReferenceTransformer(URI base,
                                JsonValue root)
                         throws JsonReferenceException
        Constructs a new JSON reference transformer.

        If base is null then only absolute URI references or fragment-only references can be resolved; an attempt to resolve a relative reference URI will throw a JsonReferenceException.

        The purpose of root is to allow fragment identifier references within the same document without the need to resolve it via an absolute URI. If root is null, then fragment identifier references are constructed from base, if specified.

        Parameters:
        base - the base URI of the referring document.
        root - the root value of the referring document.
        Throws:
        JsonReferenceException - if base is not null and is not an absolute URI.

    • Method Detail

      • isResolvable

        protected boolean isResolvable(URI uri)
        Returns true if the specified URI can be resolved by this transformer.

        The default implementation returns false. This method is intended to be overridden by subclasses that can resolve particular types of URIs.

        Parameters:
        uri - the URI to test to determine if it can be resolved.
        Returns:
        true if the specified URI can be resolved by this transformer.

      • resolve

        protected JsonValue resolve(URI uri)
                     throws JsonException
        Resolves the specified URI into a JSON value. The URI is guaranteed to not contain a fragment identifier.

        The default implementation throws a JsonException. This method is intended to be overridden by subclasses that can resolve particular types of URIs.

        Parameters:
        uri - the URI to resolve.
        Returns:
        the JSON value that the URI resolves to.
        Throws:
        JsonException - if the URI could not be resolved.

      • transform

        public void transform(JsonValue value)
               throws JsonException
        Throws:
        JsonException
